description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家、教育家、政治人物、翻译家。曾任中华民国首任教育总长、北京大学校长、中央研究院首任院长等职。他革新北大，开“学术”与“自由”之风，被毛泽东誉为“学界泰斗、人世楷模”。
description.en: A modern Chinese revolutionary, educator, politician, and translator. He served as the first Minister of Education of the Republic of China, President of Peking University, and the first President of Academia Sinica. He reformed Peking University, fostering a spirit of 'academics' and 'freedom,' and was praised by Mao Zedong as a 'titan of the academic world and a model for all'.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一所著名高等学府。
description.en: A renowned institution of higher education in China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国最高学术研究机关。
description.en: The national academy of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府时期全国最高学术教育行政机关。
description.en: The highest academic and educational administrative body of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高监察机关。
description.en: The highest supervisory agency of the Republic of China.

en: Ministry of Education of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的教育事务主管机关。
description.en: The ministry responsible for education in the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 德国的一所公立大学。
description.en: A public university in Germany.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的创始政党。
description.en: The founding political party of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末的一个革命团体。
description.en: A revolutionary group in the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清末由孙中山等组织的革命团体，中国国民党的前身。
description.en: A revolutionary group organized by Sun Yat-sen and others in the late Qing dynasty, the predecessor of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 1927年国民革命军在上海对中国共产党党员和国民党左派进行的大规模清除行动，又称“清党”。
description.en: A large-scale purge of Chinese Communist Party members and Kuomintang leftists in Shanghai in 1927 by the National Revolutionary Army, also known as the 'Party purge'.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治家、军事家，曾任中华民国总统及中国国民党总裁。
description.en: A modern Chinese politician and military leader who served as the President of the Republic of China and Director-General of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治家、教育家、书法家。
description.en: A modern Chinese politician, educator, and calligrapher.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治人物、商人，中国国民党元老之一。
description.en: A modern Chinese politician and businessman, one of the founding members of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代教育家、社会活动家，中国国民党元老之一。
description.en: A modern Chinese educator and social activist, one of the founding members of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期在北京和里昂设立的一所大学。
description.en: A university established in Beijing and Lyon during the Republican era.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家、政治家，中华民国国父。
description.en: A modern Chinese democratic revolutionary and politician, the founding father of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事及政治人物，曾任中华民国临时大总统及正式大总统。
description.en: A military and political figure in the late Qing and early Republican era, who served as the Provisional and then formal President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产主义运动的先驱、中国共产党的主要创始人之一。
description.en: A pioneer of the Chinese communist movement and one of the main founders of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 新文化运动的发起人之一，中国共产党的主要创始人及首任总书记。
description.en: One of the initiators of the New Culture Movement, a main founder and the first General Secretary of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代著名作家、思想家、新文化运动的重要参与者。
description.en: A prominent modern Chinese writer, thinker, and a key participant in the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期由宋庆龄、蔡元培、鲁迅等人组织的政治团体，旨在争取民权。
description.en: A political organization formed by Soong Ching-ling, Cai Yuanpei, Lu Xun and others during the Republican era, aimed at fighting for civil rights.

description.zh-cn: 孙中山的妻子，中华人民共和国重要领导人之一。
description.en: The wife of Sun Yat-sen and a prominent leader of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、理论家，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, politician, and theorist, the main founder and leader of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首任国务院总理，中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一。
description.en: The first Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, and a key leader of the Communist Party of China and the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，中国国民党革命委员会的主要创始人之一。
description.en: A military strategist and politician of the Republic of China, and one of the main founders of the Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培曾两度担任北京大学校长，期间革新北大，开“学术”与“自由”之风，大量引进新人物，使北大成为新文化运动的中心。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the President of Peking University twice, during which he reformed the university, fostering a spirit of 'academics' and 'freedom'. He brought in many new figures, making Peking University the center of the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，蔡元培在主持教育行政委员会期间，筹设并创办了中央研究院。
description.en: In 1927, while presiding over the Education Administrative Committee, Cai Yuanpei planned and founded the Academia Sinica.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培担任中央研究院首任院长直至去世。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the first President of Academia Sinica until his death.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培在南京临时政府担任首任教育总长，奠定了民国教育的基本规模。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the first Minister of Education in the Nanjing Provisional Government, laying the foundation for the educational system of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培曾任国民政府监察院首任院长。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the first President of the Control Yuan of the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培倡议成立中华民国大学院作为全国最高学术教育行政机关，并担任首任院长。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei proposed the establishment of the Daxue Yuan as the nation's highest academic and educational administrative body and served as its first Chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培与吴稚晖、张静江、李石曾等人提出发动“护党救国”运动，并主持中央监察委员会会议，通过了要求对共产党人进行紧急处置的决议，推动了随后的“清党”行动。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei, along with Wu Zhihui, Zhang Jingjiang, Li Shizeng, and others, proposed the 'Protect the Party, Save the Nation' movement and presided over the Central Supervisory Committee meeting that passed resolutions for emergency measures against Communists, thus promoting the subsequent 'Party purge'.

description.zh-cn: 在1927年，蔡元培积极主张并参与了针对中国共产党的“清党”行动。
description.en: In 1927, Cai Yuanpei actively advocated for and participated in the 'Party purge' targeting the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括毛泽东。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括周恩来。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括陈独秀。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培在莱比锡大学研究哲学、美学、心理学和民族学。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei studied philosophy, aesthetics, psychology, and ethnology at Leipzig University.

description.zh-cn: 与陶成章等人在上海发起建立光复会，并担任会长。
description.en: Co-founded the Guangfuhui in Shanghai with Tao ChengZhang and others, and served as its president.

description.zh-cn: 1905年加入同盟会，并被孙中山委任为上海分会负责人。
description.en: Joined the Tongmenghui in 1905 and was appointed by Sun Yat-sen as the head of its Shanghai branch.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培与李石曾等人于1920年成立中法大学，蔡元培任校长。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei, along with Li Shizeng and others, founded the Sino-French University in 1920, with Cai serving as its president.

description.zh-cn: 与宋庆龄、鲁迅、杨杏佛等人共同组织中国民权保障同盟，并被选为副主席。
description.en: Co-founded the China League for Civil Rights with Soong Ching-ling, Lu Xun, and Yang Xingfo, and was elected as its vice-chairman.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培因不满袁世凯的专制统治，于1912年7月辞去教育总长职务。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei resigned from his post as Minister of Education in July 1912 due to his dissatisfaction with Yuan Shikai's autocratic rule.

description.zh-cn: 在蒋桂战争期间，李济深应蔡元培等人之邀前往南京调停，结果遭到蒋介石扣留。
description.en: During the Chiang-Gui War, Li Jishen went to Nanjing to mediate at the invitation of Cai Yuanpei and others, but was detained by Chiang Kai-shek.

description.zh-cn: 因蒋介石扣留应其邀请前来调停的李济深，蔡元培对此十分气愤，二人关系出现裂痕。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei was infuriated by Chiang Kai-shek's detention of Li Jishen, who had come to mediate at his invitation, causing a rift in their relationship.

description.zh-cn: 蒋介石在蔡元培逝世后于日记中评价其“但有罪过而已”，显示出负面看法。
description.en: After Cai Yuanpei's death, Chiang Kai-shek wrote in his diary that Cai 'only had demerits,' showing a negative opinion.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在蔡元培逝世后发出唁电，称其为“学界泰斗，人世楷模”，高度评价并巩固其历史地位。
description.en: After Cai Yuanpei's death, Mao Zedong sent a condolence telegram praising him as a 'titan of the academic world and a model for all,' highly evaluating and solidifying his historical status.
